summary: Build a web app that compiles/runs code in many languages and provides a smart, user-friendly error explanation experience using external compilation/execution APIs.
architectural_notes: Use external compilation/execution APIs to support multiple languages.
Provide a smart error experience: parse compiler/runtime errors and present clear, helpful explanations.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Minimal compiler app logo mark, flat vector style, warm neutral palette (compiler-logo.dim_512x512.png)
- Abstract code-themed header illustration with warm neutrals and subtle geometric shapes (compiler-hero.dim_1600x900.png)

existing_features.title: Create a frontend page that lets a user write code, choose a programming language, and submit a compile/run request, then displays stdout, stderr, exit status, and timing information in a clear results layout.

Implement a “smart error experience” in the frontend: parse compilation/runtime error text into structured diagnostics (at minimum: message, severity, and best-effort line/column when present), render an error list, and show an inline code-frame preview for a selected error with the referenced line highlighted.

Use React Query on the frontend to call the backend compile/run method, including request cancellation/disable while a request is in flight, and user-visible error handling for network/provider failures.

Add a coherent visual theme for the app (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) and apply it consistently across the editor, controls, and results panels (do not use blue/purple as the primary palette).
Add generated static images to support the UI branding and render them in the frontend from frontend/public/assets/generated.

new_feature_requests.summary: All-language code compiler web app with smart error explanations (submit code, compile via external APIs, show clear helpful errors)

Add a backend API (Motoko, single actor) that accepts a compile/run request (language identifier, source code, optional stdin, optional compile/run flags) and returns a normalized result (stdout, stderr, status/exit code, and any structured diagnostic fields available).

Integrate the backend with an external compilation/execution HTTP API (generic REST) to support multiple languages, with configuration for the provider base URL and any required keys/tokens stored server-side (not shipped to the browser).

projectName: All-language code compiler web app with smart error experience
